dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: JPMorgan Chase and Delta Air Lines are kicking off earnings season tomorrow, two of the hardest-hit industries.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: JPMorgan Chase and Delta Air Lines are kicking off earnings season tomorrow, two of the hardest-hit industries.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Big banks and airlinestwo of the coronavirus pandemic's worst-hit industrieskick off earnings season on Tuesday, with JPMorgan Chase, Citigroup and Delta Air Lines all set to report before the opening bell.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Goldman Sachs is predicting weak sales growth and a collapse in profit margins for the third quarter.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Goldman Sachs is predicting weak sales growth and a collapse in profit margins for the third quarter.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Expect weak and uneven sales growth, and a collapse in profit margins, to characterize third-quarter results, Goldman Sachs said in a weekend note to clients, adding that it still expects election results will have more of an impact on stocks than earnings, and that ultimately, vaccination is essential for the normalization of the economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: They also mentioned there's a 46% chance of enough vaccine for 25 million Americans by the second or third quarter next year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They also mentioned there's a forty six percent chance of enough vaccine for twenty five million Americans by the second or third quarter next year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Goldman believes theres a 48% chance that there will be enough doses of an FDA-approved coronavirus vaccine to treat 25 million Americans by the second or third quarters, the most likely time lines, followed closely by 42% odds that this will happen by the first quarter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That timeline seems pretty optimistic, but Glenmede thinks we won't see earnings reach new highs until the second half of 2021.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That timeline seems pretty optimistic, but Glenmede thinks we won't see earnings reach new highs until the second half of twenty twenty one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Glenmede doesnt expect earnings will reach new highs until the second half of 2021, which the firm adds is not so coincidentally aligned with estimates for vaccine delivery.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which they say aligns with vaccine delivery estimates—not a coincidence, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which they say aligns with vaccine delivery estimates-not a coincidence, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Consensus estimates show an expectation that earnings reach new highs in the second half of 2021, perhaps not so coincidentally aligned with estimates for vaccine delivery, Glenmedes Jason Pride and Michael Reynolds said on Monday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And it's interesting how some sectors are doing great, like tech up 32%, while energy is down 36%.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And it's interesting how some sectors are doing great, like tech up thirty two percent, while energy is down thirty six percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The best-performing sectors this year, as tracked by S&P 500 ETFs through Fridays close, include technology (up 32%), consumer discretionary (up 23%) and communications (up 13%). The worst-performing sectors are energy (down 36%) and financials (down 16%).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: JPMorgan shares have fallen almost 28% this year alone. Jamie Dimon must be feeling the pressure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: JPMorgan shares have fallen almost twenty eight percent this year alone. Jamie Dimon must be feeling the pressure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: JPMorgan, the nations biggest bank, led by Jamie Dimon, reports tomorrow and has seen shares plummet nearly 28% this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And Goldman expects third-quarter earnings per share to fall 21% among S&P 500 firms.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And Goldman expects third-quarter earnings per share to fall twenty one percent among S&P five hundred firms.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thats how much Goldman said it expects third-quarter earnings per share will fall among S&P 500 firms, compared to a 32% drop in the second quarter and a 15% fall in the first.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But that's still an improvement from the second quarter's 32% drop, so maybe things are slowly turning around?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But that's still an improvement from the second quarter's thirty two percent drop, so maybe things are slowly turning around?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thats how much Goldman said it expects third-quarter earnings per share will fall among S&P 500 firms, compared to a 32% drop in the second quarter and a 15% fall in the first.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Slowly, yeah. Consumers are driving the recovery, but Glenmede says we're not out of the woods yet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Slowly, yeah. Consumers are driving the recovery, but Glenmede says we're not out of the woods yet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Consumers are driving the pandemic recovery, but the U.S. economy is not completely out of the woods yet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And an extra round of stimulus could really help once a vaccine is widely available.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And an extra round of stimulus could really help once a vaccine is widely available.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: There are pockets of the economy that continue to struggle, and an additional round of fiscal stimulus could put the U.S. economy on a gentler and less painful path toward full recovery once a vaccine becomes widely available.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So all eyes on JPMorgan and Citi tomorrow—any positive signs could boost the whole market.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So all eyes on JPMorgan and Citi tomorrow-any positive signs could boost the whole market.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Any signs on Tuesday from JPMorgan and Citi that the economy is on the mend will help bank stocks and the overall market, says Marc Chaikin, founder of Philadelphia-based quant investment research firm Chaikin Analytics.
